locations.title: Ubiquitous Wayfarer Inn
locations.about: Said to contain more than two dozen portals, to Prime worlds and Outer Planes, as well as permanent doors to the Clerks Ward and The Ladys Ward.
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 57.
Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 137.

NPC: Raien Blackhome, Mirta, Hulester.

Located in the Lower Ward, this tavern has entrances across the City (especially in the Clerk’s Ward) due to a variety of portals that lead to its location. It houses a large number of portals that lead across the planes. Every week, a magical statue of a wizard in the common room asks a riddle - the first correct answer wins a prize!

locations.title: Black Sail Tavern & Inn
locations.about: A quiet tavern frequented by craftsmen who work near the Armory and the border to The Lady’s Ward. Built from the remnants of an ancient galleon, though none know how it ended up in Sigil.
locations.description:
The Eternal Boundary [Adventure], p. 16.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48.
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47.

NPC: Zaren, Salja, Horrn, Inimigle, Turia.

The Black Sails tavern stands in the shadow of the Armory, the Doomguard headquarters, at the end of a dark alley between a pair of armorworks. The blackened bowsprit of an ancient galleon juts out over the figurehead. Soot has stained the sails' canvas black. Inside, dark rafters loom over about a dozen curtained alcoves that conceal the furnishings of the tavern's dim common room. Several stained and notched tables stand in the room's center, where groups of sullen crafters gather to drink quietly.

locations.title: The Great Bazaar
locations.about: The Great Bazaar, sometimes called the Grand Bazaar, is the largest market in Sigil.
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 96.

A basher can't help but notice the oddities that is the Great Bazaar: a city of tent stalls and shops, where common, rare, and magical wares are sold daily on the street. Inhabitants from a thousand worlds converse in alien languages and attempt to catch the attention of tourist and shoppers alike. Performers dance on the street corners, musicians play music with strange instruments, theologians preach their philosophies to those willing to listen, and magicians perform acts of prestidigitation.

locations.title: Tivvum’s Antiquities
locations.about: Largest supplier of gate keys in Sigil, pays handsomely for gems of any kind.
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 86.
Faction War [Adventure], p. 106.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 57.
Dragon Magazine #414, p. 2.

NPC: Alluvius 'Lu' Ruskin (female old-haglike tiefling, tonberry-like)

This store is in a tower with green marble walls. It is known as good place to buy portal keys and is run by Alluvius 'Lu' Ruskin, a tiefling, old and frail.

locations.title: Debtor’s Pole
locations.about: Merchants from all over Sigil use the pole to post the names of sods who haven't paid their bills.
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 96

A basher in need of jink might check the Debtor's Pole. Merchants from all over Sigil use the pole to post the names of sods who haven't paid their bills. Some names have rewards attached. A basher who returns a wanted sod to the creditor named on the pole pockets the reward.

Visited

locations.title: Sophie's Softies
locations.about: Pillows of the highest quality, stuffed with feathers of magic beasts, and enchanted with various effects.
locations.description:
NPC: Sophie (female half-elf, always yawning)

Catering to the highest of clientelle, customers of Sophie's leave a bit drowsy (due to an enchantment spell that entices sleep while in the shop) but otherwise highly satisfied.

locations.title: Furrowed Brow
locations.about: Wards for the mundane, the magical, and the oddly specific situation.
locations.description:
NPC: Esme (female halfling, incredibly lucky)

Esmeralda Turnbottom's mother made wards, and her mother made wards, and her mother made wards; Esme has never been one to spoil a good tradition. The wares range from mundane (a pendant against forgetfulness, carved from gingko bark) to the specialized (ground cat's tooth to drive off harpies).

Once a year, she closes up shop for a much deserved vacation, and returns with an armful of oddly specific wards. Such as 'protection from a stampede of your own cattle frightened by a thunderclap on a moonless summer night'. And yet they always get bought, and they always end up useful...

locations.title: Prime Rumours
locations.about: Ask a question, get an answer, fees may apply.
locations.description:
NPC: Jaerc Morningstar (male aasimar, beautiful and sly)

A small tent with a golem carved of ebony and ivory, shaped like an elf, sits behind a table. For a small fee, the golem will answer any question you have. Additional gold expedites the request.

locations.title: Parts & Pieces Meat Shop
locations.about: Meats from monsters of the 'verse by the Slayer of Fiends, Merchant Most Excellent, and Purveyor of Death.'
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 92.
Something Wild [Adventure], p. 16.

A meat shop that heavily promotes via flyers all around the Market Ward.

locations.title: Bronze Bezants Loanshop
locations.about: A rigorously honest loan agency but with standards to match.
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 90.

NPC: F. Moskin Faz.

For cutters who need to make big purchases but have little more than cold winds and moths in their pocketbooks, there's the Bronze Bezants. Located in the Market Ward, it's a favored stop for Cagers and out-oftowners alike who're in the market (heh) for major buys.

locations.title: Adventurer's Purse Rest Stop
locations.about: Luxurious rope trick rooms for the wary shopper.
locations.description: Affiliated with The Adventurer's Purse Inn (Greyhawk), this rest stop is a large tent, a single table, and ten altered and permanent rope trick spells. Customers can enjoy the privacy of a rope trick spell and delivered dining from the rest stop's numerous staff.

locations.title: Steelworks Factory
locations.about: Factory of Steel Predators long since dormant.
locations.description:
NPC: Wilhelmina (half elf, naive but dutiful).

A factory of the great modron Exovus's design, specializing in the construction of Steel Predators and fulfilling assassination contracts.

locations.title: Factologium Museum
locations.about: Museum dedicated to Sigil's factols, present and former.
locations.description:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 127.
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 124.

NPC: O’pok (sphinx, not amused).

A library and propaganda museum dedicated to Sigil's factols (leaders of Sigil factions). It has recently begun expanding into general artifact collection.

locations.title: Trioptic Nic’Epona Statue
locations.about: A gigantic rearing Nic'Epona statue known to have portals to many worlds.
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 79.

A gargantuan statue of a three-eyed nic’Epona (a magical sort of horse). The base of the statue holds three portals to the Prime, Elysium, and Celestia. It is guarded by a hired band of Doomguard.

locations.title: Friendly Fiend Magic Shop
locations.about: One-stop shop for scrolls, potions, wands and other magical doodads.
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 8.

NPC: A’kin, Balaka.

Magical trinkets and curio shop run by the mysterious but disarmingly polite yugoloth A’kin.

locations.title: The Ditch
locations.about: Sigil's only “natural” body of water, a refuse pit of waste (both humanoid and other) and rain water.
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 49.

A stinking mire of a canal that marks the border between the Lower Ward and the Hive Ward, favored dumping ground for deaders where even the Dustmen or corpse-pickers are reluctant to go trawling.

locations.title: Ill Defined Portal
locations.about: The doorway which deposited the adventurers in Sigil.
locations.description: A one-way? portal from Faerun to Sigil which required ringing a tuning fork on a hearth anvil of a dwarven clan.

locations.title: Ravnica Embassy
locations.about: Headquarters for Ravnican representatives who serve in Sigil.
locations.description: The embassy serves as one of the only portals to the plane of Ravnica. The majority of Ravnican guilds have representation, except for the Gruul Clans and the Cult of Rakdos. Potential visitors to Ravnica must sell their need to the Azorious Senata ambassador - only those with the truest of intentions are allowed access to the City of Guilds.
